caption.title: Monthly estimates of the basic reproductive number ( R 0) of mosquito-borne viruses similar to dengue, Zika, or chikungunya.
caption.p: We considered scenarios ranging from optimistic to very adverse (see parameter values for each scenario in Table 1); the grey line corresponds to the worst-case scenario but with a higher value of the mean daily female mosquito death rate ( μ = 0.3 instead of 0.1) to approximate data from wild Ae. aegypti populations (see [ 34– 37]). The pink dotted line shows empirical monthly values of the number of Aedes females per person (parameter m) in our study setting and period. The periods of citywide (dark grey) and focal (light grey) PPF dissemination are highlighted on the x-axis.
